Reviews.Title: “Yuck - Bring paper towels to clean - You will need them!”
Reviews.Author: GCJ17
Reviews.Content: You will need to clean up as soon as you check in - sticky chairs, hairs on the bathroom floors - but when I got to the wrinkled sheets with hairs and stains (had they even been changed?) I called the front desk to send housekeeping over, and also to get a replacement light bulb. The guy delivering the light bulb was pleasant, but the housekeeper was definitely not pleased about having to do more work, and made this very clear. The toilet runs for a long time, but this shouldn't bother you as it is drowned out by the very noisy A/C unit in the room. I would not touch the kitchen cabinets and washed all plates and silverware before using. The room had a kitchen table/island made of chipped formica, and an endtable that appeared to have been gnawed or eaten - presumably by someone's pet hopefully, rather than a previous guest! The location was pretty good, but that's really about the only positive thing I can say about this place. To top it off, a nearby guest put their used pizza box and empty drinks outside of their room, where they stayed partially blocking the walkway for 3-4 days. I guess it was a standoff to see who would make the gruelling 12 ft. trip to the nearby garbage cans first - the guest or the staff. Do a bit more research - there are definitely better extended stay places in Phoenix than this one!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, awful place. Worst place I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Raiderfan0
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation almost 3 weeks in advance of arriving for what was planned to be a 2 week stay at this location. When we arrived there were signs taped to both entrance doors that said "sold out, no rooms available". We were told that our non smoking reservation had been changed to a smoking reservation. I even showed the clerk my confirmation from the Studio 6 website. She told me, that is the only room we have left, no apology, no offer to fix it the next day, just take it or leave it. I figured I could get it fixed the next day, so we checked in and went to the room. The room smelled horrible, as I figured it would, since it was a smoking room. The carpet had nasty stains everywhere. The couch had it's own unique bad smell. The A/C filter was filthy. There were crumbs all along the bed frame (on the floor), so it was obvious cleanliness was not a top priority for this place. There was a picture above the headboard, which someone had placed a sticker on, no employee bothered to remove. There was human hair on the floor in the kitchen and in the bathroom, as well as in the shower. The bedspread had stains all over it. The bed was old and uncomfortable, and made noise anytime you moved while on it. The first thing we did was try to use the toilet, and it wouldn't flush. Well, I noticed that I had been overcharged at check in, so I took my confirmation email with me to the office to get a plunger for the toilet, and to get refunded the amount I was overcharged. Before I did that, I called the Studio 6 guest relations number to ask if it was their policy to guarantee non smoking reservations (not change them to smoking), the lady I spoke with told me that yes, it was their policy not to change guaranteed reservations to smoking. She called it the no smoking guarantee policy. So, with this information in mind, I went to the office to take care of these issues. First issue I brought up was the toilet, I believe she was the Assistant Manager (not the Operations Manager), that asked me, "well, what did you do to it"? I thought she was joking so I laughed it off, but she didn't smile or let on that she was joking, so I took that as she was being serious. Then I brought up that I had been overcharged by $70.00, the clerk was really confused as to how to fix this. She went back to the office where the Assistant Manager had run off to go eat. She returned, then tried to do something in the computer, and then went to the back again. This happened three more times. Finally, the Assistant Manager came out to fix the problem. No apology at all. So finally, I brought up that I had called the corporate office and asked about the no smoking reservation policy. The clerk went to the back office again to talk to the Assistant Manager. The Assistant Manager, loudly said (with food in her mouth from the back office) "we don't guarantee anything but a bed and four walls". The tone of her voice was that of annoyance. The clerk then returned to the front where I was and repeated what the Assistant Manager had yelled to me. I was completely shocked by the service I was receiving, and then asked if maintenance would come to look at the toilet. I was told the maintenance person was gone, but that they would get me a plunger. I waited for what seemed an eternity, and finally the clerk returned with a plunger. I could barely get the toilet to flush, but I decided we would leave the next day anyway. If only to help solidify my decision to leave the next day, at 2am the refrigerator (which is part of the bedroom), started making an extremely loud sound about every 30 minutes. This sound kept waking us up, as it would go on for about 5-10 minutes. Don't get me started on the other people staying at this place, they were very shady looking characters. There were people running up and down the stairs all night. People standing outside our room and smoking all hours of the night. They have a security guard, but the guard apparently was never in the right place at the right time. The next morning I saw broken glass in several places in the parking lot. We packed up at 9am, received our refund and left. We drove 25 miles to the Studio 6 in Tempe, AZ, which is in an infinitely better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: DanRanTravel
Reviews.Content: We made a reservation two weeks in advance only to find that the accommodations we requested were given to someone else. The only room available was a smoking room (we are non-smokers) and the bed looked like an empty taco shell with a sticky comforter over it. Their weekly rates are great but not good enough for us to stay an entire night. Finding a cockroach in the bathroom was the last straw.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay it equipped with full appilances”
Reviews.Author: sexyassredbone
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay would recommend i ever travel threw arizona u should stay

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable. Very nice, reasonable, helpful manager!”
Reviews.Author: CNolan
Reviews.Content: I'm temporarily handicapped & on crutches. They were good to get me an accessable rm. We had a few problems... microwave wasn't cleaned ( manager sent someone to clean)... competition for handicap parking & sometimes an employee would contact offenders who were taking handicap spots & sometimes not, etc. George the manager was good to listen and gave us a couple days extra cleaning... we were on the weekly rate which doesn't incl towels, cleaning every day. When we checked out, we were told the rate had DECREASED during our stay and they refunded us some money. An elderly man also checking out was told the same thing... and he was as thrilled as we were to get some money back on what was already a very good rate. Bed was comfortable. Lots of hot water in the shower. Loved having a full size frige & microwave, kitchenette so we had a sink in the bathroom & in the kitchenette. We have already recommended to friends...and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished studios”
Reviews.Author: chisana
Reviews.Content: Apparently this extended stay hotel has been recently remodeled. I just loved it here and the rates were awesome. AARP got it down to $35 a nite. $199 a week beats the competition. The kitchen is darling and the rooms look like they have new carpet...hi speed internet for $5.99 for a month if you stay that long. I would stay here again for sure. Quite cozy.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL ON THE PLANET!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LordHugenstein
Reviews.Content: The staff is useless. . . they say they have internet service but it NEVER WORKS!!!! This cheap hotel is too lazy and cheap to fix their internet!!!! TV stations are out half the time!!! They'll take you payment and then don't give a dang about you!! You're better off buying a carboard box to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Eh ....”
Reviews.Author: egoamore
Reviews.Content: I have no problem w/ homosexuals but this place was San Francisco!!! The night girl and I had a laugh about it, she was very helpful, well spoken, professional and the only one we felt comfortable talking to. We stayed for 7 days and its alright _ the kitchen was nice, the sheets and towels are ok and the t.v. was a decent size so it's more then I'd expect when a number is in the title of the place. (Bring your own shampoo! But there is a gas station within walking distance :)

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations not even met!”
Reviews.Author: R.Blair
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much and was still disappointed. If you don't need a kitchen, don't bother. The outside looks nice, but the inside is old and has horrible mattresses!!! There was no bedding for the pull out bed. Not just in the room, in the whole hotel. It's supposed to come equiped. Well, we had four of us. It was supposed to have a setting for three. Missing silverware. It had some dishes, but plan to bring your own soap to wash the dishes. The plug in the hotel broke my daughters waterpik for her teeth. The toaster would burn one side of the toast and not even cook the other side. I had to pay a larger rate ($75.00/night) because of "Spring Break." It wasn't worth it. I am pretty liberal with hotels, especially when I KNOW it's not the nicest. But really, I wouldn't stay here unless you reaaaallllly have to.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Abal
Reviews.Content: This motel says it caters to exended stays... but the minute we walked in we disliked it. I had expected 'basic accomadations', but this was just unpleasant and uncomfortable. The room was run down and threadbare, with rips in the sofa, and marks on the walls and cabinets. It was not clean -- sticky surfaces on the counter tops. The coffeemaker was dirty and stained. We had reserved a 2 bed room, which they did not have. Gave us one bed and a single pull out bed, both of which were lumpy (so were the pillows). There was no bedding for the pullout, so we had to go to the office to get it. Only one person was working on the property, so he did not come to the room with the bedding. The pullout was right next to the air conditioner/heater which blew air all night. The windows were cracked above the locks, fortunately ours was a 2nd floor end unit so the window was not reachable from the outside, as most are. The towels were stiff and thin. There was no shampoo. This is the only motel I have ever stayed in where they expect you to empty your own trash. The price, though lower than many in town at the time, was still significantly overpriced considering the poor condition of the room and beds.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Dee_Elaine
Reviews.Content: We returned home three days ago from a week-long stay at Studio 6, Deer Valley in Phoenix. It's a great value and nicer than we expected! Bed was better than adequate. They said even the bedspread is washed after each guest leaves. Everything was clean and like new, except some problems with the refrigerator. It stayed cold OK, but leaked once a day and they couldn't seem to fix it permanently. Don't stay in Room 226 unless it is fixed. We like our privacy, so we thought it was a plus to not have daily maid service. As many towels as you want are available at the front desk. A movie theatre is less than a mile away, and several chain grocery stores are close. Freeway 17 is 1/2 block away. The nicest thing about staying there was the friendly helpful staff. They were all nice. For an inexpensive place, we'd give it a 90.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Grettasmith
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this facility 9 nights during the Barrett-Jackson car auction. It is located appx 17 miles north of there. The room was a King with a couch and all the other ammentites as listed. My only issues was the carpet needed to be shampooed and the corners near the couch and around the bed were not vacumed sufficiently. Also I had to wait appx 4 hours on day #2 for clean linen as I noticed stains on the thermal blanket so I stripped the ENTIRE bed! However, I was given new mattress pads and a thermal blanket which was a good as I would want it! The pots were cheap and bendable but pratical. We paid $38 night for 2 adults so it was worth the money, most other people paid over $200 night to attend the auction. I would certainly stay again, the visit was average,not bad,not excellent, just average. One front desk staff attendent did tell me how tired she was which I thought was very unprofessional. As a bonus fresh Otis Spunkmeyer cookies are baked each night for guest:)

HotelInfo.Name: Studio 6 Phoenix - Deer Valley
HotelInfo.Address: 18405 North 27th Avenue, I-17 and Union Hills, Phoenix, AZ 85053
